body_content.explanation: not using artificial chemicals in the growing of plants and animals for food and other products:
being or coming from living plants and animals:
examples: A quarter of the contents of an average family's dustbin is organic matter.

body_content.explanation: (of a disease or illness) producing a physical change in the structure of an organ or part of the body
happening or developing naturally over time, without being forced or planned by anyone:
examples: Our policies are organic. They change as situations change.
His television career was an organic development from the endless sketches he used to enact with his best friend from school.

body_content.explanation: If a company experiences organic growth, it develops its own business instead of buying other companies:
examples: Our future development will be achieved by organic growth rather than acquisitions of other companies.
Organic chemicals are used in the manufacture of plastics, fibres, solvents and paints.
